ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Overthere faction
ygData.msgSnippet: Ack!  I wouldn t do that if I were you :) There are literally armies (well ok....squads) of undead marines wandering around the outpost.  They will undoubtedly
ygData.messageBody:
Ack!  I wouldn't do that if I were you :)

There are literally armies (well ok....squads) of undead marines wandering around the outpost.  They will undoubtedly see invis, as will the golems, and ghosts.

Mujahid,  32 Necro.  Solusek Ro

At 01:16 PM 7/20/00 -0500, you wrote:

Crap ah well.
I get invis at 8. Maybe I'll try to sneak into town and see what my faction is....I might be kos to guards but not necessarily all of the npcs.

-----Original Message-----
From: Jenkins, Jason [mailto:jason@...]
Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2000 2:04 PM
To: 'EQ_Necromancer@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Overthere faction

I know my Iksar monk was KOS in Overthere. I had to run around the side wall
and hope the boat as it passed over me in the water to get off the
continent.

Manbik Prodo'Lues - Gnome Heretic on Tunare
Ikann - Lizard Monk

-----Original Message-----
From: Mark Rafn [mailto:dagon@...]
Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2000 11:04 AM
To: 'EQ_Necromancer@egroups.com'
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Overthere faction

On Thu, 20 Jul 2000, Aaron DeLeskie wrote:

> Does anyone know if an iksar necro can do quests that occur in the
overthere
> outpost? specifically I want to do the sarnak warbraid one.
> Any help'd be greatly appreciated.

How do Iksar normally get off Kunark?  I'd imagine you're not KOS in the
outpost, so you can do the quests.  If I'm wrong, you'll have to wait for
L34, and then turn them in while using Call of Bones.
--
Mark Rafn    dagon@...    <http://www.dagon.net/>
